content.rendered:
April 3 – An Israeli-Arab terrorist, a resident of Tira, rammed his car into four police officers, lightly to moderately injuring them near Kokhav Ya’ir-Tzur Yigal. He fled to the Eliyahu crossing (near Alfei Menashe), attempted to stab security guards, and was killed.

April 5 – An attempted attack at the Megiddo Junction: A 17-year-old Israeli-Arab terrorist attempted to attack police officers at a gas station using a hammer. He was shot and neutralized and was lightly injured.

April 7 – A Palestinian terrorist opened fire at Israeli vehicles on Highway 55 near the Nabi Elias junction. A 19-year-old female soldier was seriously injured, and another person was lightly to moderately injured.

April 12 – The murder of Binyamin Ahimeir: 14-year-old Israeli boy Binyamin Ahimeir from the Malachi Hashalom farm was murdered near the Malachi Hashalom outpost while herding sheep by a terrorist from the Arab village of Al-Mughayir.

April 21 – An Israeli was lightly injured in a bombing attack in Binyamin after kicking a booby-trapped PLO flag.

April 21 – A shooting attack and an attempted stabbing targeting IDF forces in Beit Anun, near Kiryat Arba. No injuries were reported. The Palestinian terrorists were neutralized on-site.

April 22 – Three Israelis were lightly injured in a car-ramming attack in the Romema neighborhood of Jerusalem. The Palestinian terrorists, residents of Hebron, were arrested after a police chase.

April 24 – One person was lightly injured in a stabbing attack on Highway 60. The Palestinian terrorist was killed.

April 26 – An 18-year-old Jewish woman was critically injured in a stabbing attack in Ramla by an Israeli-Arab terrorist.

April 30 – A Muslim terrorist of Turkish origin stabbed a police officer at the Flowers Gate in Jerusalem, moderately injuring him. The terrorist was killed.

excerpt.rendered: In April, Palestinians carried out 513 terrorist attacks, including stone-throwing incidents, resulting in 1 death and 28 injuries.
